DEPARTURE FLIGHTS MODIFIED : THE NICE COTE D'AZUR AIRPORT ESTABLISHES A PERMANENT AND AUTOMATIC DATA EXCHANGE WITH THE NETWORK MANAGEMENT OPERATIONS CENTRE AS AN 'ANI' AIRPORT (ADVANCED NETWORK INTEGRATED), IN ADDITION TO THE EXISTING 'ACDM' (AIRPORT COLLABORATIVE DECISION MAKING) MESSAGE EXCHANGE. AN 'ANI' AIRPORT HAS FULLY ADOPTED THE AIRPORT-'CDM' (COLLABORATIVE DECISION MAKING) CONCEPT BY PROVIDING TO 'NMOC' THE FULL SET OF 'DPI' MESSAGES (DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION: 'PDPI, EDPI, TDPIT, TDPIS, ADPI AND CDPI') AND 'GAPI' MESSAGES (GENERAL ARRIVAL PLANNING INFORMATION). THIS ACTIVATION ADDITIONALLY COVERS THE INTEGRATION OF NEW 'TTOT' VALUES ('TTTOT, ETTOT, CTTOT') IN 'EDPI', 'TDPIT', 'TDPIS' MESSAGES. WITH THE INTRODUCTION OF 'PDPI', NEW VALUES IN 'DPI' AND 'GAPI' MESSAGES EXCHANGES WITH EUROCONTROL SYSTEMS, THE ATFM NETWORK MAY BE IMPACTED AS EARLY AS 48 HOURS BEFORE EOBT AND MAY BE USED FOR AIR TRAFFIC FLOW MANAGEMENT (ATFM) PURPOSES. DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (DPI) MSG PROVIDED TO NETWORK MANAGER OPERATIONS CENTER (NMOC). 1.1. ADS-B DATA REQUIRED 1.1.1. FOR ADS-B DATA USED BY THE AD OPERATOR AND EUROCONTROL, PILOTS OF AIRCRAFT EQUIPPED WITH MODE S AND ADS-B FUNCTIONALITY MUST, WHEN OPERATING ON THE GROUND: A) SELECT AUTOMATIC MODE AND THE ASSIGNED MODE A, OR B) IF AUTOMATIC MODE IS NOT AVAILABLE, SELECT ON AND THE ASSIGNED MODE A - FROM THE REQUEST OF PUSH-BACK. - AFTER LANDING, UNTIL THE AIRCRAFT HAS STOPPED ON HIS STAND. - WHEN THE AIRCRAFT IS FULLY PARKED, THE PILOT SHALL SELECT STBY. 1.1.2. WHEN THE AIRCRAFT IS CAPABLE OF COMMUNICATING ITS IDENTIFICATION (I.E. THE CALLSIGN USED IN FLIGHT), THIS MUST BE ENTERED (VIA THE FMS OR TRANSPONDER CONTROL PANEL) AT THE TIME OF THE PUSH-BACK REQUEST. 1.1.3. THE CREW MUST USE THE FORMAT DEFINED BY ICAO TO ENTER THE AIRCRAFT IDENTIFICATION. 1.1.4. IN ORDER NOT TO COMPROMISE THE PERFORMANCE OF SYSTEMS BASED ON SSR FREQUENCIES (INCLUDING AIRBORNE TCAS AND SSR RADARS), TCAS SHOULD NOT BE SELECTED BEFORE RECEIVING CLEARANCE TO LINE UP, AND SHOULD BE DESELECTED AFTER VACATING THE RUNWAY.

ADS-B DATA FOR ECRA (EUROPEAN CONNECTED REGIONAL AIRPORTS PROGRAMME) OPERATIONS. 1.1.IN ORDER TO COOPERATE WITH ADS-B RECEIVER USED BY AIRPORT OPERATOR AND EUROCONTROL FOR USE OF THE ECRA PROGRAMME AT EINDHOVEN AIRPORT,PILOTS OF MODE S EQUIPPED ACFT WITH ADS-B FUNCTIONALITIES WHEN OPERATING ON THE GROUND SHALL: A)SELECT AUTO MODE AND THE ASSIGNED MODE A CODE OR B)IF AUTOMODE IS NOT AVAILABLE, SELECT ON (E.G.XPDR) AND THE ASSIGNED MODE A CODE. -FROM THE REQUEST FOR TOWER PUSH-BACK OR TAXI,WHICHEVER IS EARLIER -AFTER LANDING,CONTINUOUSLY UNTIL THE ACFT IS FULLY PARKED IN ITS STAND. -WHEN THE ACFT IS FULLY PARKED, FLT CREW SHALL SELECT STBY. 1.1.2.WHENEVER THE ACFT IS CAPABLE OF REPORTING ACFT IDENTIFICATION (I.E.CALLSIGN USED IN FLT), THIS SHOULD BE ENTERED (THROUGH THE FMS OR THE TRANSPONDER CONTROL PANEL) AT THE TIME OF THE REQUEST FOR TOWED PUSH-BACK OR TAXI, WHICHEVER IS EARLIER. 1.1.3.AIR CREW MUST USE THE ICAO DEFINED FORMAT TO ENTER THE ACFT IDENTIFICATION. 1.1.4.TO ENSURE THAT THE PERFORMANCE OF SYSTEMS BASED ON SSR FREQ (INCLUDING AIRBORNE TCAS AND SSR RADARS) IS NOT COMPROMISED, TCAS SHOULD NOT BE SELECTED BEFORE RECEIVING CLEARANCE TO LINE UP, AND SHOULD BE DESELECTED AFTER VACATING THE RWY.

FOR FLIGHTS DEPARTING FROM FRENCH AIRFIELDS, LOGON MUST BE INITIATED NO LATER THAN CROSSING FL150. SX0060/22 AIP SUPPLEMENT EBBU/FIR - RESTRICTIONS RELATED TO THE RUSSIAN INVASION OF UKRAINE - 08SEP22-UFN 1 AVOIDANCE OF OPERATIONS IN THE CRISIS AREA BELGIAN AIR OPERATORS AND OWNERS OF AIRCRAFT REGISTERED IN BELGIUM SHALL NOT ENTER UKBU, UKLV, UKBV, UKDV, UKFV, UKOV, URRV. FLIGHT OPERATIONS SHALL ALSO BE AVOIDED WITHIN THE BUFFER ZONE EXTENDING OUT TO 200 NM ALONG THE UKRAINE/RUSSIA BORDER. OPERATIONS WITHIN LUUU SHALL ONLY BE UNDERTAKEN IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE APPLICABLE AERONAUTICAL PUBLICATIONS ISSUED BY THE REPUBLIC OF MOLDOVA. ADDITIONAL RISK ASSESSMENT AND FLIGHT PLANNING DECISIONS SHALL BE TAKEN BEFORE OPERATING UUWV. 2 RESTRICTIONS FOR RUSSIAN OPERATORS LL RUSSIAN REGISTERED AIRCRAFT AND AIRCRAFT OWNED, CHARTERED OR OPERATED, OR OTHERWISE CONTROLLED BY NATURAL OR LEGAL PERSONS FROM THE RUSSIAN FEDERATION OR BY OPERATORS HOLDING AN AIR OPERATOR CERTIFICATE (AOC) ISSUED BY THE RUSSIAN FEDERATION AUTHORITIES ARE PROHIBITED TO ENTER, EXIT OR OVERFLY BELGIAN AND LUXEMBOURGISH AIRSPACE, EXCEPT FOR HUMANITARIAN, SAR AND LEASED AIRCRAFT ONE-WAY RETURN FLIGHTS WITH THE PERMISSION OF THE APPROPRIATE BELGIAN OR LUXEMBOURGISH AUTHORITIES AND IN CASE OF EMERGENCY LANDING OR EMERGENCY OVERFLIGHT.
